I had this on Gear VR before getting a Rift S, and I bought every expansion they put out for this game. It's an absolutely wonderful party experience, but this 5 star review applies only to the game with all the experiences available. If they made them all available on Rift S, I'd buy them on the spot.

No matter what I try, this game and only this game crashes as soon as I start it. I see the splash screen with the Turtle Rock logo, and get a fatal error crash on my monitor. Too bad. Gear VR version was neat back in the day, wanted to play the better looking version. I don't seem to be the only person with the problem either. I understand it's free, but I paid for this and all of it's expansion sets on gear VR. None of that is here. That doesn't have anything to do with the one star review though. One star is what a game gets when it crashes on startup. Everything else works fine. Can run Blade and Sorcery on max 60 fps.

This app is worth paying for. The visuals are very well done...it has decent repeatability due to the changing scenes. The party compatability factor alone is more than enough reason to download this. Honestly, I wouldn't have downloaded it for $5 but after playing it and using it to introduce my friends and family to VR it's worth 10 easy BUT IT'S FREE!! so do yourself a favor and download it before the devs realize they could sell this game

The bad...it's still in development so there are only 4 scenes of about 7 minutes each...that's it I just wish there was more content because it's so well done
I felt as if I was in the air. I could feel my stomach churning and my legs go weak. I would like to see more of these. Nice job.

review_title: Very well optimised, and well made!
one_reviews_text:
I don't usually scare too easily, and the left door was more entertaining... But the right door... Blimey, it had me almost jumping out of my seat! Genuinely creeped me out.

Beyond this, the game runs absolutely perfectly, and there were absolutely zero frame-drops which really helped with the immersion.

Loved it, it scared the life out of me. For a free content, you can't get any better. The robot scene is awesome and the stories are very scary. I recommend you read them from right to left, so you introduce yourself to the characters. :D
Cheers for the developers!
A great horror game.

All jokes aside, there isn't much to it but it is enjoyable for what it is. Be great to show someone VR who has never tried it as you don't really have any controls to get used to. Just sit back and let it roll and enjoy this creepy little experience.

Great "game" considering it is no cost to you.
I use quotation marks because it's not really a game, it's more an experience. You just watch what happens with no real way to interact or take action, which isn't a bad thing. It's kind of an immersion horror film if you will.
I'm sad to see that the second release takes a different direction actually, and goes with a storyline which requires interaction.
If they churned these out every couple of weeks and sold them for a reasonable price, I'd be on it like blue on sky.
Not really interested in slogging through another tedious step by step story line.
Give me more of the creepy, jump scare experiences this first episode presented!

review_title: OMG need to clean my undies

review_title: Love the Experiences that are here...
one_reviews_text: Face Your Fears is my go-to Experience for newcomers to VR (who can handle a good scare, anyway), and when I found out there were more Experiences developed I immediately booted up the game after work to check them out, as the originals are still some of my favorites. I was gravely disappointed to discover these new Experiences aren't for the original headset and I hope the developers will listen to their fanbase and port those Experiences over. This is my first and (so far) only review with the sole purpose of bringing to light an issue I hope the developers intend on rectifying. Either way, what we do get with Face Your Fears is 100% gold and I want to congratulate the Devs on creating such iconic Experiences for the forefront of VR. To readers of this review: don't listen to those saying these Experiences aren't worth it, just remember these are Experiences and should be treated as such in your contemplation of their worth; I guarantee if you sit down and jump into Face Your Fears, you'll stand up with a new perspective on what VR can bring to the entertainment scene (especially for the horror genre).

review_title: Fun to Show, Lack of Support
one_reviews_text: This is great to show to folks who are new to Rift so that they can get an array of experiences. Was disappointed to find that the newer stories are not supported on the Rift.

Face Your Fears is an excellent horror game, esecially considering it's free, and is a fun way to scare your socks off. It combines multiple fears (hince the title) in 4 different "short films," with each one having a well-done and nicely crafted style. It looks and feels amazing, so prepare to be Scared!

review_title: Fun to show off, but lack of support.
one_reviews_text: While this is one of the games I like to show off my oculus with as I love seeing VR newbies reactions to it, the sheer fact that there's only 2 experiences on the rift + touch (I know the ghost one has three, but it's the same setting so I count it as one) and they refuse to bring the other experiences over really sours the experience. They have the extra content for the Oculus Go, but NOT the rift? I'm not gonna go spend extra $200, plus the cost of the game, plus the cost of the DLC to enjoy this once and then never touch it again until I show someone else VR for the first time. This will be the last turtle rock product I will be purchasing as long as they're doing this only supporting weaker versions of a platform while basically telling the people who have the better headset "Too bad, so sad, maybe you should have bought the cheaper headset."

Like others have stated, it would sure be nice to have the extra content but that hasn't stopped me from showing this off to noobs to the rift.  This and Gray get more screams and screeches than just about anything else I have in my collection.
It would have been 5 stars if the extra content that the go received was added. I really like the game and would gladly pay for the extra content. Please make this happen devs.

review_title: Best experience for VR so far
one_reviews_text:
You guys did a really good job.
After several years playing in VR i didn't think anything could scare me like it did the first time i tried it on.

I get scared easely, especially with video games ( like Deadspace ). T.Vs and movies are okay, I loved Haunting on hill house ( or whatever the name ) but this VR game really scared the crap out of me.  Good work, I would pay for something like this but it would need to have at least a few dozen different experiences.

review_title: Great experience, but lack of content
one_reviews_text:
First of all, I have to say that this is a great experience.
I am pretty sensitive with vertigo and it was very difficult to watch the first experience without removing the rift...
Same with the bedroom fear... it makes you feel scared, which is impressive.

The "game" (I say "game" even if this is not directly interactive) clearly deserve 5 stars.
However, for me, it's loosing one star because of the lack of content.
It's a pity because the developers have created some other great experiences, but not available for the Oculus rift. Such a shame...
I would be ready to pay up to 15€ for a complete experience and I hope the developers will make the other experiences available for rift user...
I would give it 5 stars if they port it to the quest. Would love to see that!

Both experiences were great!  The standing up experience is on par.  Regardless of being a VR noob, this was a really cool experience.  I like little jump scares and have always played scary games (RIP Resident Evil 1 back in the 90s).  I would definitely recommend this game to anyone, plus download everything thats free, the worst you can do is uninstall if you don't like it lol.

I think this game is probably one of the best ones out on Rift. The feel of the game is genuinely terrifying and is great for parties or groups. The stories run smoothly and are highly immersive. The only issue I have is when you lean too far any direction, the game resets it's view so you're no longer sitting in bed like you used to be. Still continues the story but just a minor annoyance.

It's a shame because otherwise this is one of the essential virtual reality apps that everyone needs to try. I mean, try it out for yourself if you don't believe me. Now imagine a bunch more.

It's a free horror experience, short but incredible. The skyscrapper scene is really intense and well done. The other experiences are great as well, really inspires fear on you (except the Ghost scene which could be a bit better, hence my 4 stars).

One star+ because it´s free.
The right door is super scary, the left door almost made me fall over.
There are two main scenarios. One as a child in bed at night, and one on a massive skyscraper. The child scenario has three options but they all revolve around the same ghost.
Come on bring more out!
Really cool experience.  I really enjoyed the left door. The right door scared the crap out of me and I didn't actually complete it lol.

I had played this in the gear vr and while the clowns were very scary the skyscraper was not that bad. The skyscraper in the Rift is absolutely awesome! I am too scared to do the clowns and other scenes in the Rift at this time as they were very scarey in gear I can only imagine how they are in Rift.  For a free experience to get your adreneline rushing this cant be beat.
These are great but my gosh give us all of face your fears . it is oculus

Love this, and have really enjoyed watching people try it out for the first time. But why are we stuck with just the two doors, when loads more have been released for Gear VR, including the amazing sounding Stranger Things door! Really poor that the developers are ignoring the Oculus Rift platform.

I loved this! Definately scary. Loved watching other people do this experiance. 
But.... Needs more content! Pleeeeaaasseee?!

review_title: One of the best titles on this store
one_reviews_text: The height scene is mind blowing!

This game needs more than heights and demons. My fear is drowning. Where is that? 
The included fears are alright.
The clown one was actually kinda scary. 
Nice 'game' overall

After seeing videos of this on youtube, i was annoyed to see that most of the scenarios are only on Gear VR and that we only get 2 on Oculus. I'd probably have paid for the extra ones so this is a let down considering it's great for when friends come round.

The game has two "areas" to go to

The first one is for what I believe to be if you are afraid of heights. It is short and not very scary in my opinion

The second area on the other hand, is extremely scary. There are three diferent books you can do and each is different. The first is light as a feather, and basically it is almost like a poltergeist and every drawer and door is opening and closing with voices and a jumpscare at the end. The second one is The ghost, the spirit of mason. It is basically a gollum like thing going around your dark room with glowing eyes appearing in scary places and another jumpscare in the end. The third one is fun with Jingle, The friendly clown. It is basically a doll that is a clown going around your room and scaring you. There is also a jumpscare in the end as well.

I give this game 5 stars because I got it for free, and got scarred for life. I enjoyed it and was happy I got it, if you want to see me play it, visit our youtube chanel: https://www.youtube.com/channel/UCx5mdKiOZK5h4Q0zGK1lvfQ

This was very great!!! You also have to consider it is a free game and most of VR's are on Beta and will improve eventually over all as it is, but this game is great as of now. I know it is missing more scenerios, but I got the thrill that I expected of this game. 10/10

There are differences between the Oculus Rift and Gear VR version, with the latter having many more fears.  If you read about this app from Internet website e.g. Stranger Things, Flight 101, Birds, etc then this is not the app.
I would rate it 5 stars if it had the DLC's like it does in the Gear VR! I have an Apple device and would love for the DLC's for Oculus Rift!
On Samsung Gear vr, this has a lot more experiences, Bird Attack, Snakes & Spiders, plus the one where the lady buries you alive.  What gives?
The stories are well made, especially the one with the robot. The effects are great, I think its a keeper and very good to show to new users (its impressive).
Good to play but very horifying.
...It cured my chronic constipation quicksmart.
Incredibly scary and immersive.
There is many scary game or videos in VR but they are'nt scary at all, this one succeed to scare me
Excellent experience a must, it will scare you to death :)

If you have a friend who would like to try the VR for the first time, I highly recommend putting them in this game first to get the feel of virtual reality. It also gives a little spook at first for people who get scared easily!
AMAZING!!!! Make more experiences for Oculus Rift,  REALLY COOL!!!!!!
Made my hands sweat, and my heart beat quickly.

It's sad to see Gear VR version getting a bunch of scenarios, but the Oculus version gets only two! I would gladly pay for extra ones.  That aside, a great, free, scary and fun VR experience, perfect for showing to your friends
Im new to VR and this experience made my hair stand up. This is a much watch. Would love to see more lke this.
This is absolutely amazing. No other game even comes close to it

This was very scary to me, and I'm a 40yr old guy. It relies on much more than just jump scares, but also psychological horror as well... it messes with your head. The music and ambient environmental sounds really lend themselves well to the overall experience. As other have mentioned, I'm sad to hear the Gear VR folks get more options and new experiences to try. I'd love to have more for the Rift. I did a playthrough of this game on my YouTube channel, but please note that watching will leave no surprises for you to uncover on your own. Also, my language use is quite strong in this video, so it is not suitable for younger audiences or those sensitive to strong language. https://youtu.be/wf8i1dB4Veg
Heh, got some screams from some of my friends.
This scared me so much, but we need more content please. I'd be more then happy to pay for extra content of the same quality.
This is a perfect game to show someone who has never tried VR before AND IT'S FREE!!

As someone who is scared to death of heights, this was too much. I swear I felt like I was there. Hands soooo sweaty and heart racing. I have not got beyone like 1 minute of  the highrise thing, I have to take the headset off. Going to try and work may way though it.
Only 2 experiences compared to the 5+ of the Gear vr version. Unacceptable.

review_title: Short but fun and very scary
one_reviews_text: (update: I took a star away because of the lack of support for the Rift. It seems the devs have decided to ignore its existence for a while now.) I really keep hoping they release more content for this as I found this experience to be among the best in VR. Super realistic and the scariest I've tried thus far. I love every single experience within this title and can't emphasize enough how much I'd like to see more content for Rift!
A Game that it can compare with P.T. of Hideo kojima
I see other people with more doors than 2, the 2 doors in this are ok?. But why do others have more doors?.

Compared to other titles, I would have gladly paid $10 for this. Great to show friends, and not too much jump scares.

But there are no downloadable contents like the description suggests...

review_title: Hey devs! I would have paid for this!
one_reviews_text: I'm too scared to do most of what's currently on offer (which is fairly minimal but worth trying). But for a version with all the DLC the Gear VR version got, especially Stranger Things, I'd pay $5-10, maybe a little more.
No Updates For Rift only Gear VR
stil this game is for kids VR games are still to kidy and arcade:(

review_title: Clown doll in the bed at night simulator
one_reviews_text: I've always fancied waking up in the night stuck to my kid's bed, alone late at night, and being unable to move whilst poltergeist-style evil happens around me. This is hardcore realistic - You don't even have so much as a 12-gauge shotgun to defend yourself with ... This is definitely a party pleaser. Try getting your mum or dad to try this, as their first introduction to VR. They'll be forever hooked. When's the sequel coming? I want to be stuck on an operating table whilst a psycho tries to give me a liver transplant.
Wow this is really scary, must get!!!

This is my favorite "game" to show off the Gear VR with all the extra paid content.  I would really love to see that content ported over to the Rift.  All are awesome and would love to see the spider and bird areas added to the Rift.  My only complaint is that if you move on the Rift the scene can get a little messed up since it's kind of tied to being forced to not move.  Overall, wonderful and for free this is a must have addition.
but still realy  great
If you have played VR more than 3 times then most of this game won't be scary at all to you.  The only thing that is marginally scary is when a monsters runs around your room, even then its mediocre.
I got it when I heard it had Stranger Things, but it doesn't in the Rift version. At least it was free so I don't have to ask for my money back.

For maximum effect, try this around midnight, in a completly dark room (to avoid the nose gap light..) and alone... scared every person who tested it ! Downgrade to 3 stars because of poor content compared to Gear VR version ! Please give us more !
i crapped my pants. i crapped all over my pants. there is crap on my pants.

Children are not scary by default, nothing about them is scary, children can be overpowered quite easily. Clowns are funny and them flailing around rediculously is even more so. The robot scene was great. Cheap jumpscares are not scary. HOWEVER the visuals were very fun to look at and I enjoyed it overall. I think this is a great start to making horror in VR
The production quality on this app is just so good. I look forward to see what else this studio comes up with.
This game is AWESOME! It is really scary though. Not for the faint of heart. I had to hold my friends hand when he played this...

review_title: Great for scaring friends and family :D
one_reviews_text: Very well executed VR Experience, to confront with the most feared things in VR. Intrusion in the private comfortzone and height. Good job!

review_title: Great in Gear VR - poor content in rift
one_reviews_text: I don't get it! The same in Gear VR has a lot more experiences. And the most of them are really great. However - the rift version doesn't have these other experiences. So it's a really short experience. I am talking minutes - not hours.

I enjoyed this 'horror' movie style. Just like being a star of a hooror film. You have a choice of reading three books and I chose the ghost one first off and a child was up to michievious stuff in trying to make you jump, you have to keep a look out for him as he can strike his demonic eyes anywhere in the room! The next one was light as a feather and you get your typical poltergiest slamming of doors and anything that moves. Only to find Jack in the box at the end of your bed who suddenly appears when the 'pop goes the weasel' tune is played in the chime! The third one is the clown who appears, then disappears in different areas of the room -only for the child who haunts the bedroom to reveal himself behind the scary clown going ons. Cleverly done and more needs to follow!
The scary heights experience is so cool

review_title: One of the best free apps on Oculus
one_reviews_text:
A great experience to really pull in first comers to VR. This is always my go to app to demonstrate (and scare) my family and friends. 

Hopefully Turtle Rock Studios will port over the extra experiences available on Gear VR in the near future!
Found a demon child under my bed. 10 / 10.

Not enough people try the left door. I have demo'd this game to a lot of people and ask heights or horror, it's like 5-2 horror wins probably due in part to vr motion sickness. After trying richies plank, I actually added a big book (like 16 inches x 16 inches, 1 inch wide) on top of a small folded towel (to give a little wiggle). This had varying results... but always funny!
Love it. Was really scared.

If you're looking for an experience to share with people on Halloween this is the one! Really really creepy ghost activity in a haunted bedroom. Or give someone vertigo as they hang off the edge of a tall building. Really nice production values and animation.

review_title: For a free game it is very cool
one_reviews_text: Watch it late at night just before you go to bed. You will have some cool jumps.
I crapped my pants.  no...............i really did!

Considering this game is free, it is quite fun and me and several friends all played it one night. Got some good videos, some good scares, and had a good time. Also let my 7 year old sister try it out...she got legitimately scared!
This is very good piece of VR experience BUT I was very disapointed when I heard that GearVR version has few more interesting scenes. Why?

Two different experiences, the bedroom or future apartment, let you face your fears. The bedroom part is longer and even changes the placement of the jump scares at times, though both experiences are good.

EDIT: Had to take off a star. On GearVR, where it is also free, there are seven more experiences. Why?

review_title: Creepiest VR experience I've tried yet!
one_reviews_text: This is now going to be my goto game to show off to friends in VR. The first scene was really good with a great sense of scale and vertigo. The second was extremely creepy with headphones on and plays with tension and payoff perfectly! Shame the only interaction is dependant on where you look, I could have really done with the ability to pull the covers over my head in the second one! XD

I say we don't need them because it costs nothing and you get plenty for what you get for free. When I tried it, I thought I would get the "bad news" out of the way and picked the dark room first. That didn't last long, and I at least went through the giant skyscraper part, but vertigo is real and unfortunately my 5 and 3 year old children (who don't have to experience it) want me to replay it all the time. This is a great tech demo and will test your nerves for the cost of nothing but your time.

review_title: My brain fell for it completely. ;)
one_reviews_text:
Many stories I've read about experiencing VR have pointed out how effective the illusion is by the physical response it triggers. I first felt it when I teleported to higher ground in Robo Recall and my brain told me to take a step back from the edge.

Then I downloaded this and stepped through the left door...

A few moments later, my feet grew roots as my brain shouted at me: "DON'T LOOK DOWN!!!".
"It's OK, don't freak out!" I replied.
"THIS IS NOT OK!!... AND STOP LOOKING DOWN, FFS!!!" he wailed...

(FWIW, I'm not afraid of heights, just the usual fear of the sudden stop at the bottom.)   

Needless to say, if you're new to VR, this is worth a look. It's short and non-interactive, but it's only a small download and it's everyone's favourite price: free.

review_title: Why is there more content for the phone
one_reviews_text: i love the app.....best horror one out there.....but why is there more content for the one on my phone?
the vertigo one may or may not work, but the ghost one , I did ghost book and one more, i could not do the clown one after that, I found my hands were sweating after and i am not a scary kinda guy..
Played 10 seconds through the ghost scene... alt+F4 before it finished because it was quicker than unplugging my computer.  Going to therapy tomorrow.
The scary one literally gives me goose bumps. And the point is i am the type of person who can easily handle most of the horror movies!
I love horror, suspense and cheap jump scares. This really did scare me and I loved every second!

Sittin' here with my friend Mary Jane, I chose the bedroom and the ghost book.  Je-sus!  That creepy thing scared me every single time I saw him pop up.  The last time made me actually scream out loud when I saw him.    It was so loud that I thought I had woken up my baby.  I don't want to try another simulation tonight, due to the terror I just witnessed.

i love the buried alive thing but this was really funny when my uncle
tryed the ghost he screamed like a girl lol.

I almost quit the room one before it had finished, wasn't sure I could see it through to the end. Very scary and brilliantly done.

I was terrified to move in the skyscraper one in case I fell (both in the game and in reality!)

An excellent experience to show what can be achieved in terms of scariness in VR.
NO THANKS. ALMOST DIED.

review_title: Scary is boring ; Vertigo is beautifull
one_reviews_text:
Scary parts were really boring - the vertigo one was interesting and the vusials for that portion were great.

Only recommended for the vertigo one.

No use complaining, Rift users are cut short on this title. I love it and use it to show others what VR can do, REALLY wish it had the other experiences. Anyway, content is 5 stars as it is in castrated form.
This is excellent for free, i hope they release some more, very scary.
to developer if you make a second one am happy to pay for it
I'm not a person who scares easily.  Yet I found myself afraid to turn and look at what was making noise. Awsome game.
Gear VR had more scenes! wheres ours?
Good for a free app.
Watched two grown men scream like little girls.
I would have paid for this and I'm such a tremendous cheap a**
This has more polish than most paid content. Great horror showcase for friends. Free too? Incredible.

review_title: Best played with Friends and Family
one_reviews_text: This game is the perfect introduction to VR, especially for people who are not gamers.  It's mostly just an experience, but what an amazing one.  Great 3D, 360 visuals, nice scares.  Lots of laughs involved (laughing at the person with the VR set).
It was scary like hell! For people afraid of heights, clowns and objects flying around. Enjoy
I liked the vertigo one, but the scary ones were er... too scary.
I like to watch people watching this :))))

This is like an intro to VR horror games to see if your heart can take it. It's very well done, and definitely has the creepy vibe from each short story. Also, it's just as much fun to watch someone play this, as it is playing for yourself!

This thing is brutal, i screamed like a Girl :'-D (and i'm not!). Really shows the potential of horror games in VR. 
it's short yes, but It works and it's free, so 5Stars.

P.S. i was too scared to use that clown-book so far :-O

But why do i have to change sound to headphone rift audio to default to get sound through the headphones.
No other vr game has to do that.hence 3 stars i would have gave it more if i did not have the messing about with the sound.
Played two minutes. Need new pants.
Why lie? The experience is the best I've ever had for free.
I HAVE SO MANY REGRETS
I thought this was epic. watch it in a dark room on a cold rainy night. You'll see, you'll all see!!!muhahahahaha

Very impressive animation & environments.
Scared the living crud outta my wife.

Must have to impress friends.
Face your fears, its very immersive. I was pretty scared!
Honestly, this game is amazing on the Gear VR system. There are so many choices. I would love to see those choices on the Rift system. Currently it is a great game at this price.
Need new pants...
By far the best VR horror experience currently available. I'm not the person that gets scared very fast, but this one hit me hard.
Scaring awesome
quite basic room setting, graphics are rendered simply and the sound is obvious. I did not freak out. honest!

wasn't expecting to really be scared, but oh boy. The bedroom scenes are really intense and genuinely had me pooing myself. My sister had a go as well and when she did it there was a different ending which scared us all!
Excellent production and one of the first things I show people when they try my Rift. I would love to see more experiences.
This is the first thing i show people.
How can I write a review if I coudn't resist for more than a few seconds in every scene?
This is fantastic :)
This game offers what you expect of a VR horror game, nothing more, nothing less, it's a great experience when you completely inmerse in the game and sure is scary!
Horror is really amazing, the heights are so amazing i couldn't play it all the way through thought i was going to have a heart attack.. This is a breathtaking experience, thanks devs!!

This didn't help either.
https://www.youtube.com/channel/UCGhJ3GNBsEY5dCwB4CrqLmw
That was amazing! it blew me off my feet! Great work guys. :)

review_title: One of the best Free Apps on Oculus
one_reviews_text: For a tamer experience pick the left door... the action is somewhat cartoonish, but enjoyable. For a scary experience pick the right door. All three are FANTASTIC! Four experiences...very short... but all worth the free download. Kudos to the development team!

The scary bedroom "fears" was a lot of fun and had some great jump scares, and a general feeling of dread about it. Loved it.The sky scraper "fears" was something else altogther. First time I tried, I actually laughed out loud at myself as I VERY gingerly went down to my knees. Second time, I said out loud "it's not real... it's not real", however, my brain screamed "yes it IS !! WE'RE GONNA DIE, YOU FOOL !!!!" hahahha

More "fears" please !!
Geez

Excellent animation, pacing, and sound design (all of which I find undervalued in VR experiences) paired with well above-average graphics do an excellent job of immersing you in the experiences. The heights demo in particular uses really clever movement and orientation changes to really amplify the sense of vertigo. Really, really well done.

Bedrooms scenes scared the living hell out of me. I'm 36 years old.
The skyscrape is more an awesome demo than anything else. I got a little fear at times, but for the most part, it's going to be my new go-to demo to show off the Rift.
I will buy EVERYTHING from the same developers if they make more like this.

Skyscraper is best viewed standing - great short animation with this one. Do not try this one if you are prone to motion sickness. It really can mess with you, if you have a fear of heights. Haunting has 3 books to choose from, each with its own horror sequence. This experience is best viewed seated and has no issues with motion sickness. My only complaint with these is that if you lean too far the app will reset your view which is jarring and takes you out of the experience. However, it is a nice touch how the VR sequence reacts to where you are looking.
Not gonna lie, the first part with the aliens and the robot was whatever but the second part with the bedroom and the ghost kid, that scared me good. Can't wait to see what else these guys do.
Worth checking out
This game is a great way to face your fears. The bedroom one was really frightening. Can't wait to see more fears to overcome!
the most horrible one is the first one, the crown.   especially when it appears next to you.

Un'esperienza davvero ben realizzata. Molto intensa e ricca di momenti ad alta tensione. Non può mancare nella vostra collezione di VR experiences da far provare a chi si affaccia al mondo delle Virtual Reality!

The cheap Hollywood jump scares didn't scare me at all, and the Robot scene...was "meh" and didn't invoke a real feeling of heights at all. I had been sweating in a mine craft world climbing a tower, but this didn't do anything for me. The city/world was also not realistic. Very short, ok it's free, but ultimately a nice, little yet "meh" demo that didn't impress me really.

Seriously this is it, the future of the horror genre. Turtle Rock Studions so have to make  Paranormal Activity VR. 

Can't you just see it, looking at a screen in VR and seeing someone standing behind you. Instinctively  you turn and they are right there in your face. Change my shorts, these ones are done!
LOL >"///< -That stupid clown made me shreek like a lil' girl + ended up wearing my beer -too funny....lets do it again!

review_title: Does what it says on the tin
one_reviews_text:
The height one is the first VR experience to make me remove the Rift, I literally was afraid to move and the vertigo hit me - hard! Love it! 
Wish there was a spider one (tho maybe start off small then get bigger), my other phobia. 
Look forward to seeing what the creator comes up with next.

review_title: First time I've ever been scared
one_reviews_text: I'm 25 and don't scare easily. I'm talking jump scare type stuff. This was the first experience to give me that feeling. Also, I was truly put off balance when in the robot experience. Standing up and all the movement truly made me feel like I was falling. If a video game could deliver these feelings, I would be willing to pay full price for it.

review_title: Nice quick way to freak out your friends
one_reviews_text: This is a nice free app to give people a quick scare. Whether it is clowns, creepy kids or fear of heights. The Gear version has some additional add-ons and if they keep the same price for the spiders, snakes and a bad date, it is well worth it.

I am a 26 year old man. I had to pause the game and get my fiancee to comfort me. This was my first time legitimately scared in VR. I'll admit it, it was very reminiscent of the times I used to lay in my bedroom at night and hallucinate monsters. Perfect atmosphere and animations to incite fear. I honestly didn't expect it to effect me this much.

well the robot is pretty cool but dernit little boys room scares the poop out of me .  Therefore got my 5 stars. Im 50 plus yrs. old and didnt know i could be afraid of a app. I havnt been able to finish little boys room yet...

Neighbors came to check on us because my  daughter and son (14yr&13yr) was screaming and jumping at the clown/ghost in the bedroom part. Neighbors are house next door not under us like in apartments!  I didn't finish the first clown one but I do not like horror movies at all. I almost pooped myself!!

I give it 5 stars because it actually got me some.  I played horror games like any other game when I was 5 or 6 years old (hasn't changed much.)  I tried out the "kitchen" demo that the ps4 had and it was a bit of a joke imo.  I tried out all the "horror" scenarios that this had and it had some jumpscares that got me a little.  I didn't scream or anything but I did get some goosebumps on the ghost one.  I'll still sleep soundly tonight but it actually got me a little.

I didnt think there was going to be a VR showoff demo that rose to the level of the dreamscape one with the T-rex demo but in particular the door to the left
with the robot was quite frankly genuis and VR at its best!! on a side note....I wish VR designers would give us enviroments we can walk in and just enjoy at our leisure......for instance the beautiful brightly lit apartment unit we find ourselves in, is actually very therapeutic for me who suffers a bit from seasonal affective disorder.  its rainy and snowy alot here and its so wonderful to find myself in a brightly lit apartment looking out a nice big window into a sunny enviroment. if only I could walk around say a whole house and exist in that enviroment when I choose, say on a snowy day or night. I think that should be a strength and an avenue I wish more VR designers would create.because standing in that apartment facing that huge window....NICE.  sorry for the side rant, but this demo is amazing!

review_title: Needs more variety, but a good demo
one_reviews_text: I enjoyed the height/robot scene, that was actually pretty cool. The bedrooms scenes are a bit redundant to me and a bit slow. I wasn't scared in any of the scenes....but I'm sure if I showed my mother or those friends I have that jump easily, they might be. This needs more variety. I was expecting more different types of scenes with more different types of fears. I guess the fact that it's free, well....I can't complain lol.

It's free too. I hope this animation studio/ game company can make full games cause from what i experience so far is darn good. 
The giant robot scene was awesome to witness and the room part was too creepy and intense for me to get through in one sitting. It creeps me out even when i know it's just a game. Amazing visuals and atmosphere. I just have one complaint, the physics and particle effects on the robot scene could be improved. Like when the giant robot fell down the building, the impact felt  weak. 

It is not very interactive but a cool experience for the VR.

You feel like you are 10 years old again, waking up in the middle of the night and everything seem live and out to get you. Hope they continue making more and more situations to put you in, cause this was really scary and fun! Recommend it!

fantastic free experience. the robot demo was very cool. the bedroom one's are hilariously terrifying.  i was shocked how frightened they made me. i have one more bedroom story to go. couldnt bring myself to do it after the first two!

3 short ghost stories had me more on edge than the entire story of Resident Evil 7.  This experience is done right, from correct use of lightening, sound direction and pace. This  shows the true power of VR.  Now imagine full games \ VR movies with this level of quality.

I consider myself a horror movie junkie.  Nothing that I watch causes me to be the least bit scared.  The little boys room though, although not scared, did bring the goose bumps on my arms and make my heart beat a little faster with anticipation.  5 stars to you

This has a better horror feel than any of other games I've tried. It isn't long and doesn't have any story but it's definitely something to try. Robot scene was great, and the bedroom scenes were a little long but very well done. Great horror demo.

This is awesome. I am an middle aged adult, regular viewer of horror and splatter movies, but this scared the sh*t out of me.
The depth of VR makes you feel attacked for real. Can't stand this for very long.
Be warned!

Despite being a Gear VR game, Face your Fears does a good job at immersing the player and pulling off some pretty good jumpscares (your mileage may vary of course), but without the content currently present on the mobile platform I can't give this full marks.
Very scary. Thank you.
Scared the SHEEEET out of meh.
Love this App hoping there is more doors to come Great work

I'm normally pretty good with these sorts of things but the Clown one in particular scared the pants off me! The best one out of all 4 experiences imo. I would have been quite happy to pay for this, so good that it's free!

review_title: The skyscraper scene is pretty cool
one_reviews_text: It's free, and definitely worth trying. The skyscraper scene is pretty cool. The bedroom scenes are supposed to be scary, but it somehow just felt tacky. Then again, most horror is a bit tacky.
THIS GAME IS AWESOME YOU CAN PICK THE STORY LINE 10/10
I screamed like a little child, my son screamed like a little child, some of the best 'scary' VR stuff I have seen.
44 year old horror fan. And I'm not scared to admit this scared the hell out of me. Had to quit after a couple of them. More of these please! Very good

review_title: Dread halls is way more scary
one_reviews_text: It's like they hold back on the scares, since it has the oculus name on it. This was not very scary, and I really really hate scary stuff in VR. This did'nt scare me at all.
Works really well as a short scare demonstration and has nice graphics and details.
A nice experience. Im a grown man and it gave me chills. I think that its neat to see the different things you can do in a single room. I hope to see more from these guys.
this will deffinetly freak you out!
Very nice experience, some relatives could not sleep at night lol, very good!!
I wanna die now <3
this is by far the mosy scary expeience i have had but super fun and it was free!

review_title: I swear it was the dogs!
one_reviews_text:

Thank you for putting in a quit button, so i could quickly quit after getting scared sh*tless!
